thread.title: Protester displays 'Wenger Out' sign at anti-Donald Trump march in central London
thread.title_full: Protester displays 'Wenger Out' sign at anti-Donald Trump march in central London

author: tom dutton
title: Protester displays 'Wenger Out' sign at anti-Donald Trump march in central London
text:
Tuesday 21 February 2017 12:41 GMT Click to followES Sport A protestor calls for the end of Arsene Wenger's long Arsenal reign Martin Abrams 
One protester used Monday's anti- Donald Trump march in central London to call for an end to Arsene Wenger's reign at Arsenal. 
Thousands gathered to oppose Trump's upcoming state visit to the UK, but one objector had an altogether different message. 
Amid a flood of placards with anti-Trump scrawlings was a flimsy piece of cardboard carrying the words 'Wenger Out'. 
Wenger's Arsenal contract is due to expire in the summer and the Frenchman has been offered a new two-year deal to take his stay at Emirates Stadium beyond 22 years. Sutton goalkeeper agrees to join Arsenal in exchange for six pasties 
Wenger says he will make a decision over his immediate future in 'March or April', while the 67-year-old insists he will remain in management beyond this season whether that is in north London or elsewhere. 
Fans have long been split over the issue of Wenger's future, but Robbie Lyle - star of popular YouTube channel Arsenal Fan TV - told Standard Sport there was a noticeable change in attitude after the club was crushed 5-1 by Bayern Munich last week. 
Lyle said: "Interviewing fans after the Bayern Munich game, what I found pretty telling was that even a lot of people who have been pro-Arsene Wenger were saying the time has come now for him to go." In Pictures | Sutton United vs Arsenal | 20/02/2017 In Pictures | Sutton United vs Arsenal | 20/02/2017 1/50
